The claim is based on data from the Wisc: WKCE) test scores for Milwaukee Public Schools (MPS) students in 2011.
The Department of Public Instruction: DPI) recalibrated the scoring standards for the WKCE test, resulting in a significant increase in the number of students rated as non-proficient.
Under the old scoring standard: approximately 42% of MPS students were rated as not proficient in reading, and nearly 41% were rated as not proficient in math.
The new scoring standard raised the perc: in reading and just over 80% in math.
